i1.name: Unseen Threat
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Kha'Zix''' gains ''Unseen Threat'' whenever the enemy loses {{tip|sight}} of him or he activates {{ai|Void Assault|Kha'Zix}}. ''Unseen Threat'' causes his next [[basic attack]] against an enemy champion to deal {{pp|14 to 116|color=magic damage}} {{as|(+ 40% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|'''bonus''' magic damage}} and {{tip|slow}} them by 25% for 2 seconds. Once gained, the empowered attack lasts until used.
i1.descriptionHtml: Innate: Kha'Zix gains Unseen Threat whenever the enemy loses sight of him or he activates Void Assault. Unseen Threat causes his next basic attack against an enemy champion to deal 14undefined âˆ’ 116undefined (based on level) (+ 40% bonus AD) bonus magic damage and slow them by 25% for 2 seconds. Once gained, the empowered attack lasts until used.
i1.notes:
* Any form of vision loss may trigger ''Unseen Threat'', such as {{ai|Curse of the Black Mist|Senna}}, {{tip|nearsight}} and {{ai|Brushmaker|Ivern}}.
* {{ai|Void Assault|Kha'Zix}} grants ''Unseen Threat'' even if '''Kha'Zix''' never becomes unseen (e.g. affected by {{tip|true sight}}).
** Other {{tip|stealth}} such as {{cai|E|Senna}} and {{ii|Duskblade of Draktharr}} does not do this.
* Both the attack's damage and bonus spell damage are grouped under the same Spell ID.
** Because of this, a single ''Unseen Threat'' attack does '''not''' trigger two {{ri|Electrocute}} stacks or {{iis|Muramana}} {{nie|Shock}} damage twice.
